story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the heart of the Polish countryside, there lived a kind and gentle Jewish mother named Riva. She had a young son named Moshe, who was the light of her life.

Moshe was a curious and adventurous boy, always eager to explore the world around him. He loved to play in the fields and forests that surrounded the village, discovering new wonders and making friends with the creatures that lived there.

One day, Moshe came home from his explorations with a strange and beautiful bird that he had found injured in the forest. The bird had a brilliant coat of feathers, shimmering with all the colors of the rainbow.

Riva was amazed by the bird's beauty and took it in, nursing it back to health. She and Moshe cared for the bird together, feeding it and keeping it warm until it was strong enough to fly again.

As the bird grew stronger, it began to sing the most beautiful and enchanting songs that filled the entire house with joy and wonder. Riva and Moshe would sit and listen to the bird's music for hours, their hearts filled with happiness and peace.

But one day, the bird's songs grew sad and mournful. Riva and Moshe knew that it was time for the bird to return to its home in the forest.

With tears in their eyes, they opened the window and watched as the bird took flight, soaring high into the sky. The bird's songs grew fainter and fainter until they could no longer be heard.

But even though the bird was gone, its music lived on in Riva and Moshe's hearts, filling their dreams with hope and love.

And so, every night, as Moshe drifted off to sleep, Riva would sing to him the bird's songs, reminding him of the beauty and wonder of the world around them, and the importance of cherishing every moment.

As the years passed, Moshe grew up to be a kind and gentle man, just like his mother. And whenever he heard the songs of birds, he would think of the beautiful bird that had once filled their home with music and joy.

And with that thought, he would smile, knowing that he was never truly alone, for the bird's music lived on in his heart, and in the hearts of all those who had loved and cared for it.

The end.

Good night my dear, sweet child. May your dreams be filled with love, joy, and the beauty of the world around us.
